meanings.def: to enter a country, town, etc. using military force in order to take control of it
examples: Troops invaded on August 9th that year.
invade something When did the Romans invade Britain?

meanings.def: to enter a place in large numbers, especially in a way that causes damage or problems
examples: As the final whistle blew, fans began invading the field.
The cancer cells may invade other parts of the body.

meanings.def: to affect something in an unpleasant or annoying way
examples: Do the press have the right to invade her privacy in this way?
You feel tense with worrying thoughts constantly invading your sleep.
